title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Defesa do Esporão Rosé (Alentejano)
description: A blend of Aragonez and Syrah, this ripe wine offers red fruits and a soft texture, with just enough acidity to keep it crisp at the end. It is ready to drink.

title: Humberto Canale 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Patagonia)
description: Foxy aromas of wet dog and plum and berry feed into a raw tannic palate. This tastes herbal, with a green note added to its core red-fruit flavors. A choppy, hard-tannin finish is rugged and abrasive.

title: Il Chiosso 2010  Gattinara
description: This offers earthy aromas of game, tilled soil, leather and forest floor. The lean rustic palate offers suggestions of dried cherry, a hint of dark spice and a gamy note alongside firm acidity and dusty tannins.

title: Grayson 2015 Lot 11 Chardonnay (California)
description: A light earthy, toasted aroma and mostly savory rather than outright fruity flavors mark this medium-bodied, dry wine. The texture is smooth and rich enough to complete a good picture.

title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas are surprisingly light for the variety, with notes of rose water and flowers. It drinks off dry, with lightly styled fruit flavors, with the concentration wanting.

title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of tropical fruit, apple, melon and spice lead to lightly styled fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't seem to be all there.

title: Francis Ford Coppola 2014 Rosso & Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Almost neutral in flavor, this light and smooth wine is innocuous, crisp and refreshing.

title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Tinto Velasco (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: A fruit-forward nose with earthy plum and berry aromas leads to a sharp, lively palate with high acidity. Plum and berry flavors are rendered angular by said acidity, while mild salty notes rise up on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Leaping Lizard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: With ripe, generic fruit flavors, a soft texture and slight sweetness, this is a very easygoing, easy-drinking, light-bodied wine.

title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Rosé (Lisboa)
description: Lisboa, with its cool climate, lends itself to crisp rosés like this. This lively fruity wine is touched by hints of vanilla and layers of red-fruit flavors. It is light and ready to drink.

title: Aniello 2015 006 Riverside Estate Merlot (Patagonia)
description: Dry earthy herbal aromas of tomato, red-berry fruits and oak set up a full palate with pounding tannins. This tastes roasted and herbal, with notes of bell pepper, tomato and creamy oak. A hard-tannin finish confirms that this Merlot skipped charm school.

title: Benvenuto de la Serna 2015 Mil Piedras Viognier (Vista Flores)
description: Lime and tangerine aromas are light and dusty, with a yeasty note. This feels mostly sound but basic, with leesy, melony flavors. On the finish, this loses intensity and turns bready in flavor and soft in feel.

title: Decoy 2013 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This plummy, dusty red wine is simple and straightforward in its approach to tannin and oak. Offered at a fair price it should please a wide range of palates.

title: Trapiche 2014 Oak Cask Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Reedy green-leaning aromas of plum and raspberry feed into a creamy palate. This tastes primarily of herbal red-berry fruits that finish oaky, dry and spicy.

title: Xanadu 2015 Exmoor Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This shows some pungent, boxwood-like scents up front, followed by modest passion fruit and a bit of citrus, falling away on the finish. Drink now.

title: Château Lanscade 2015  Bordeaux
description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins and attractive red-berry fruits. There is just a touch of dryness that gives this easygoing wine its structure. Drink from early 2017.

title: Château Troupian 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: High-toast aromas are followed on the palate by flavors that are more about wood than fruit. That gives the wine a tough, extracted character that probably will not go away.

title: Château Vrai Caillou 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers
description: This is a crisp and fruity wine that's perfumed and full of citrus and green fruits. It has a lively character that is filled out with the ripe fruitiness of the vintage. The aftertaste, bright and fresh, suggests it will benefit from another few months. Drink from summer 2016.

title: Cliff Creek 2011 Sams Valley Vineyard Claret (Southern Oregon)
description: Roughly equal portions of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot go into this tannic blend. It may be a little too far along the aging curve, at least for showing much fruit. It's drying out—displaying a touch of leather—and should be consumed as soon as possible.

title: Del Rio 2013 Claret (Rogue Valley)
description: The Claret benefits from an additional year of bottle age, integrating the components (60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% each Cab Franc and Malbec). Tart red-berry fruit is accented with light toast from barrel aging. There's a slight hint of burnt rubber that will blow off with decanting.

title: Delfino 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is a light simple red, without particular varietal character. It's much like an inexpensive California Merlot—fine for every day drinking, generic and unassuming.

title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2015 Lote 138 Red (Douro)
description: This wine is light in tannins and ripe in fruit, with a delicious red-berry character. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This wine is smooth and soft, with an attractive creamy texture and light acidity. Yellow fruits and stewed pears are lifted by a mineral texture. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of “scantily dressed.” Drink now.

title: First & Local 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Light cinnamon and sugar aromas, and fresh, fruity and lightly sweet flavors make this wine easy on the palate. The texture is soft.

title: Gru 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: This inky-colored zesty wine offers aromas of sour cherry, leather and a hint of dried herb. The extremely simple, easygoing palate shows red plum and a hint of clove alongside loose knit tannins.

title: Oak Knoll 2014 Cloud Rest Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a neutral, papery white wine, with a flat, rather than lively mouthfeel. The apple flavored fruit is there, along with a touch of licorice, but the freshness seems to have been lost along the way.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Mula Velha, “the old donkey,” is a younger wine than its name suggests. Brisk and fruity, it offers firm tannins and layers of blackberry fruit. With a touch of oak aging, the wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from late 2017.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and soft tannins. With plenty of acidity to keep it crisp, the wine has a cool, flavorful character topped off by berry fruits. It's ready to drink.

title: Martin Ranch 2013 Thérèse Vineyards Dos Niñas Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling is classic for the grape: blackberry, dried lilacs, wet asphalt, beef char and black rocks. The palate is more muddled, with flavors of clay and freshly turned earth, without much spice or fruit to note.

title: Rock Point 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This single vineyard cuvée is quite light, yet retains your interest with a thin dusting of cocoa and ground coffee around the tangy berry fruit. It's a bit earthy, but a pleasant quaffer, along the lines of a generic Bourgogne.
